I tested the following in isolation of any other code:

import torch
import torch.nn as nn

a = nn.Conv2d(4,32,kernel_size=8,stride=4)
b = nn.Conv2d(32,64,kernel_size=4,stride=2)
nn.init.orthogonal_(a.weight.data)
nn.init.orthogonal_(b.weight.data)

The first orthogonal_ works and the second one segfaults. Is this some sort of memory error caused by the larger number of filters? The segfault happens even when I omit the first call for the smaller number of filters.

body:
I tested the following in isolation of any other code:

```
import torch
import torch.nn as nn

a = nn.Conv2d(4,32,kernel_size=8,stride=4)
b = nn.Conv2d(32,64,kernel_size=4,stride=2)
nn.init.orthogonal_(a.weight.data)
nn.init.orthogonal_(b.weight.data)
```

The first `orthogonal_` works and the second one segfaults. Is this some sort of memory error caused by the larger number of filters? The segfault happens even when I omit the first call for the smaller number of filters.
